001package tictactoe;
002
003import java.util.Scanner;
004
005/**
006 * Contains a few different utility methods.
007 *
008 * @author Tapio Malmberg
009 */
010public class Utils {
011    /**
012    * Returns a random integer in the range [min, max].
013    * @param min the inclusive lower bound for the random number.
014    * @param max the inclusive upper bound for the random number.
015    * @return a random integer between min and max.
016    */
017    public static int getRandom(int min, int max) {
018        return min + (int) (Math.random() * ((max - min) + 1));
019    }
020
021    /**
022     * Keeps reading from the standard input stream until the user inputs an
023     * integer.
024     * @param errorMessage the error message that is shown when the input cannot be
025     *                     converted into an integer.
026     * @return an integer read from the input stream.
027     */
028    public static int readInt(String errorMessage) {
029        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
030        int number = 0;
031        boolean incorrectInput = true;
032
033        while (incorrectInput) {
034            String str = input.nextLine().trim();
035
036            try {
037                number = Integer.parseInt(str);
038                incorrectInput = false;
039            } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
040                System.out.println(errorMessage);
041            }
042        }
043
044        return number;
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Keeps reading from the standard input stream until the user inputs an integer
049     * that is in the range [min, max].
050     * @param min                      the inclusive lower bound for the integer.
051     * @param max                      the inclusive upper bound for the integer.
052     * @param errorMessageNonNumeric   the error message that is shown when the
053     *                                 input cannot be converted into an integer.
054     * @param errorMessageNonMinAndMax the error message that is shown when the
055     *                                 input is not between min and max.
056     * @return an integer read from the input stream.
057     */
058    public static int readInt(int min, int max, String errorMessageNonNumeric, String errorMessageNonMinAndMax) {
059        boolean incorrectInput = true;
060        int number = 0;
061
062        while(incorrectInput) {
063            number = readInt(errorMessageNonNumeric);
064
065            if (number < min || number > max) {
066                System.out.println(errorMessageNonMinAndMax);
067            } else {
068                incorrectInput = false;
069            }
070        }
071
072        return number;
073    }
074}
